channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: Former Canadian Deputy PM John Manley discusses Mark Carney's White House visit
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin talks with former Canadian Deputy Prime Minister John Manley about Prime Minister Mark Carney's visit to the White House and how Canada plans to respond to Trump's tariffs.

item.title: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney to meet President Trump at White House
item.description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney won his election pledging to push back against President Trump. On Tuesday, the two leaders are scheduled to meet at the White House.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Canadian Prime Minister Carney to visit White House, Trump administration asks court to dismiss suit restricting access to abortion drug, Trump plans to impose tariffs on movies produced outside U.S.

item.title: Author Ted Genoways discusses his new book 'Tequila Wars'
item.description: Journalist and author Ted Genoways follows the violent, unpredictable and hugely profitable world of tequila through the story of its most successful maker, Jose Cuervo, in his book "Tequila Wars."

item.title: For the first time, most cardinals choosing the next pope are not European
item.description: Pope Francis appointed many cardinals from the Global South and, for the first time, fewer than half of voting cardinals who will choose the new pope are European. How will this influence the vote?

item.title: Rwanda says it's in 'early stages' of talks with U.S. to take in deported migrants
item.description: The tiny east African country of Rwanda says it's holding "early talks" with the Trump administration about taking in deported migrants from the U.S.

item.title: German lawmakers reject Friedrich Merz as chancellor in a stunning 1st round
item.description: The setback is a major embarrassment for the leader of the center-right Christian Democrats, less than three months after winning the most votes in Germany's federal election.

item.title: Republicans considering selling off federal land to pay for Trump's domestic agenda
item.description: Republicans are considering selling off some federal lands to pay for President Trump's domestic agenda, which is reigniting a decades-old controversy in the West.

item.title: Doug Ruch's dying wish is to help people by volunteering in all 50 states
item.description: When his doctor told him he had just 12 to 18 months to live after his cancer metastasized, Doug Ruch decided to devote his remaining time to doing community service in all 50 states.

item.title: Trump administration asks court to dismiss suit restricting access to abortion drug
item.description: Trump's Justice Department asked for a lawsuit against the abortion medication mifepristone to be dismissed. It's a surprising move, given that it is similar to one the Biden administration made.
